alert.note: Alert for Coastal Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued May 27 at 11:47AM EDT until May 28 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents, large breaking waves expected, and strong longshore currents in the surf zone. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Onslow County beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 2 AM EDT Sunday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Dangerous shore break can throw a swimmer or surfer head first into the bottom causing neck and back injuries. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: Swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
